## Functions in R

👉🏻 Perform a specific task according to a set of instructions.

--
👉🏻  Some functions we have discussed so far,

> `c`, `matrix`, `array`, `list`, `data.frame`, `str`, `ndim`, `length`, `nrow`, `plot`

--

👉🏻 In R, a function are **objects** of **class** *function*.

```{r, comment=NA}
class(length)
```

--

👉🏻 There are basically two types of functions:

    
 > 💻 Built in functions 
        
            Already created or defined in the programming framework 
            to make our work easier.

 > 👨 User defined functions
           
           Sometimes we need to create our own functions for a specific purpose.




---

It is possible to see the source code of a function by running the name of the function itself in the console.
